meanings.definition: The quality or state of being farcical.
meanings.sent1: The farcicality of the situation made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: The play's humor relied on the farcicality of the characters' misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The farcicality of the clown's oversized shoes added to the comedy.
meanings.sent4: The farcicality of the political debate was like a circus in motion.
meanings.sent5: The farcicality of the situation was so ridiculous, it was hard to take seriously.

meanings.definition: The use of farce or absurdity in a literary or dramatic work.
meanings.sent1: The writer's farcicality in the play brought humor to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The movie's success was due to the clever farcicality of the plot twists.
meanings.sent3: The farcicality of the novel's characters made the story entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The farcicality of the comedy show was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The farcicality of the play's dialogue was both witty and amusing.
